item.title: Trump Threatened to Send Military Police to Minnesota. Here’s What They Can and Can’t Do.
item.description: Even during unrest, active-duty soldiers’ role in domestic law enforcement is limited, experts say.

item.title: Journalists: How to Include Family Perspectives in Prison Death Coverage
item.description: Family members’ experiences are key to understanding deaths in custody. These engagement tactics can unlock their untold stories.

item.title: How ICE Agent Who Killed Renee Good Could Face State Charges
item.description: Prosecutors would have to overcome many legal obstacles, from the officer’s possible immunity claims to the laws that govern deadly use of force.

item.title: After Haitians Endured Campaign Lies, An Ohio Town Prepares For ICE
item.description: Falsely accused of eating pets, and worse, Haitians in Springfield have survived harassment, and now fear deportation.

item.title: It’s Hard to Stay Motivated When You’re Facing ‘Death by Incarceration’
item.description: LaMarr W. Knox on stalled prison reform measures: “In New York prisons, hope is nonexistent because so many of us are loaded up with long sentences.”
